threats.title: doing allowed actions by getting access to database connection
threats.mitigation: - use account based conection withrestricted scope of access

threats.title: Cross Site Scripting
threats.description: Attackers could let execute JavaScript through User Input and then execute JS to change the Software from that Point
threats.mitigation:
- Not executing Javascript which is coming from Backend
- escape js from inputs

threats.title: cross site scripting through user input
threats.description: attackers could create content with html code inside which executes js
threats.mitigation: remove all js from html

threats.title: prevent xss attack via html rendered element
threats.description: In the frontend application is one item which renderes html content from backend, here attackers could try to inject Javascript Code here
threats.mitigation: stripe all js elements from html string

threats.title: NoSQL Injection protection
threats.description: Users could try to inject unallowed data into database or try to read from database throgh injected code
threats.mitigation: Validate User Input and escape it before saving into database

threats.title: Access of a User through Bruteforcing Accountname / Password
threats.description: User could get access of user by brute force the password of an account
threats.mitigation:
- not allowing weak passwords
- implement rate limiting for user login

threats.title: Server Config Information Disclosure through API
threats.description: Attackers can get Service Config Information through Error Messages in Graphql
threats.mitigation:
- implement custom error handling instead of giving unfiltered error message from passport especially
- on prod disable stack tracing

threats.title: cross site scripting attack to execute code in frontend of other users
threats.mitigation: escape all user inputs & don't execute js which is comming from backend
threats.description: Attackers could execute cross site scripting attack to execute code in frontend of other users or getting information from backend through console logs or alerts

threats.title: Attackers with access to container could manipulate logging files
threats.mitigation: - usage of audit logging of kubernetes microservices logging mechanism
threats.description: Attackers with access to container could manipulate logging files

threats.title: Attackers could communicate with backend from own frontend
threats.mitigation: - origin check with whitelist of allowed frontend services

threats.title: Attackers could get information over the network
threats.mitigation: - encrypt all traffic with TLS

threats.title: sending too big requests and let server crash
threats.mitigation: - request size checking

threats.title: session hijacking
threats.description: the attacker could manipulate his session to become an higher privileged user
threats.mitigation: use custom secret to sign session with hash value

threats.title: DDoS Attacks
threats.description: Attackers could try to slow down or shut down the server by sending too many requests
threats.mitigation: implement rate limiting

threats.mitigation: Validate User Input and escape it before saving into database

threats.title: Through Access to Kubernetes Cluster Attacker Could add malicious containers or exchange
threats.mitigation: - enable private cluster without public ip for control service kubectl
threats.description: Attackers could try to slow down or shut down the server by sending too many requests

threats.title: Attackers could get root access and information to cluster secrets through malicious pods
threats.description: Users could try to inject unallowed data into database or try to read from database throgh injected code
threats.mitigation: - Through Secure Boot all Containers can't have root access and with Shielded GKE Nodes it checks if node in the cluster is VM which is initiated from google site through certificate

threats.title: DDOS Pods from outside
threats.description: Sending lot of requests to pods from outside to get down the Application or parts of the application
threats.mitigation: - deny all ingress & egress by default when it does not need them
